summary: The document details the employment records of Judith R. Burford, who served as a Document Clerk for the Research/Document Unit-MLK Task Force under the HSCA. It encompasses payroll authorization forms, personal leave records, and memorandums related to her employment, including salary adjustments. The release of the document was partially postponed due to privacy concerns regarding Social Security numbers, highlighting its significant historical interest. The document has undergone several reviews and postponements, with a subsequent review scheduled for 2017.
key_findings: Judith R. Burford was employed as a Document Clerk for the MLK Task Force with an initial salary of $10,000 per annum, which was later adjusted.
The document's release was partially postponed due to privacy concerns over Social Security numbers and its historical significance.
Multiple reviews and postponements of the document have occurred, with the next review set for 2017.
Employment records include detailed payroll authorizations, leave records, and certifications ensuring no familial relationships to current Members of Congress.
